Best Welding Helmet – Reviews & Buying Guide

June 9, 2021February 1, 2021 by Brayden
1.4k
SHARES
ShareTweet

We know that welding Helmets are used as process of welding emits of light in three types:

• Visible light damage your retinas with intense brightness.

• Infrared light (IR) melts everything it falls on.

• The third one is ultraviolet that is invisible.

Infrared Light burns the skin. Welding Helmets covers your face and neck so protect from burning.  Helmets protect from damages to the skin due to incident light produced in the result of welding activity.

UV rays harm the skin severely. To keep the eyes safe, welding hoods have special shaded glass to prevent harmful light. Filter glass is categorized according to its effectiveness to stop harmful light. A high standard glass ensures more protection and vice versa. A welder needs to lift his hood to rightly target the arc. Now the problem is that our eyes will be disturbed due to the exposure to very bright light.

So auto adjustable welding hoods work best. They prevent the intense flash of light instantly. That is why it can be seen that the welder works without removing his hood, so the hood protects when the arc flashes. The welding hoods provide excellent safety, although they need a fixed-shade lens, that is either number 9 or 10.

Overview:

The Miller Digital Elite helmet provides X-mode, which is that the feature that creates it stand out. this is often their name for the technology that detects the electromagnetic field generated when striking an arc.

If you’re often out of position, or in confined spaces, your sensors might not “see” the arc. Or in bright sunlight, your auto-darkening feature might not close up once you aren’t welding. With X-mode, these problems are eliminated, and importantly, you are doing not risk being flashed.

The Digital Elite helmet also weighs but the Viking 3350. Both are light as compared to other helmets on the market, but if you would like the lightest helmet between the 2, that might be the Miller Digital Elite.

Best Welding Helmet Buying Guide

You’ll find several different options when buying the simplest welding helmets. Below are a number of the foremost important factors to think about when trying to find the simplest welding helmets.

Welding Helmet Viewing Area

The helmet’s viewing area are some things you ought to consider also. The hoods with large view window are nearly around 4″ x 3″ and more.

3.5″ x 1.75″. If you’ll be using it during a limited space, then you need to select a welding hood which has a wider and special view window.

Optical Quality

All the glasses of the auto-darkening welding hoods are tested first for inner regulator and are rated according to the quality of vision they offer.

This reflects the clarity of the sight while looking through the lens. Auto controlled darkening lenses are available in almost four categories depending upon the level of clarity they offer. These welding hoods have a visual level of 1/1/1.

Arc Sensors

While choosing to buying an automatic welding hood, you would like to also consider the number of used arc sensors. These sensors are liable for detecting flashes as you’re employed and can darken the helmet during a fraction of a second so as to stay your eyes protected.

Two arc sensors should be enough. Four sensors are the ideal as they greatly reduce the chance of the helmet failing to respond to the light that flashes.

Helmet Weight

One needs to keep it in mind that that he will be need to wear his welding hood for a long duration of time so he needs to opt on a hood  with which he is  comfortable to wear.

The welding hoods which are heavy put a pressure over the neck and cause pain although they do not hurt. You may get hurt by the welding helmet even when it is not too heavy, while we put it on for the first time.

Comfort must be among the top most priorities when selecting a good welding hood. When it involves this, the lightweight and padded helmet could be a far better choice.

They do not hurt your neck even if you keep putting on for a long duration of time. It needs to make it sure that your selected welding helmet is fitting best with your skull size.

Power Source

Now the welding hoods are available with a variety of power sources. Some work with lithium batteries, while others with solar energy. There also are people who use both.

Most of the time welding helmets with both lithium and solar powers sources are the best welding helmets among all. Furthermore, if one among the facility sources runs out, you’ll use the opposite. If one chooses a battery-powered welding hood, he should confirm first either these are replaceable or not.

The welding hoods with replaceable batteries option are more compatible. It is because we just need to attach charged batteries and start using it. But one must make it sure to hold a group of alternative power source batteries with him.

One it comes to solar powered welding hood, one needs not to replace its batteries again and again. This feature is what you’ll usually get if you select a helmet with auto-off features.

Lens Shade

A wide range of auto- darkening welding helmets is available in the market with variety in their shades options. When your welding hood will be having more shades option so it would be working best in different requirement level of welding.

When the welding works requires to be often changing and adjustment of the settings and processes of your hood, then he needs to get a welding hood that has a wide range of options to adjust the shades. The level somewhat between 9-13 is considered to be normal.

However, if a welder is welding at low electric current, so it is difficult to target the arc clearly, the shade level should be adjusted between 6-13.

Sensitivity

Sensitivity regulator is one of the most important features to consider when we need to purchase a welding hood.

Fortuitously, all most all of the automatic darkening welding hoods available in the market can be adjusted at a minimum brightness level that will activate the obscuring. This function is useful when a welder is welding at a very low electric current and he needs like to enhance the sensitivity.

It’s one of the important features when a welder is working alongside some other welders and he is exposed to several arcs.

Lens Response Time

The response time is how briskly the lens from light turns to dark when the arc is initiated. Lenses respond at very fast speed. The professionally used lenses are graded at rate of 1/20,000 in a second. If you weld often, it becomes hard to carry on with a lens which has fast response time.

Safety

For your own safety, always select a welding helmet which meet the prescribed standards of ANSI. Currently, the safe set for welding hoods is ANSI Z87.

Customization

You’ll now find different sorts of welding helmets within the market. Previously welders had very few colors available but now they can choose from a great variety of colors and graphical prints.

Price

The price of the welding hood differs a lot but it ranges from $40 to $800!

FAQ’s

The Best welding hoods have a power source that works best for about 7 years that is really a long span and the replaceable batteries can go for 3 years. In cheap welding hoods, batteries may stop functioning in starting few months. When choosing a welding helmet, you should choose solar powered or hoods with replaceable power sources.

Lincoln Viking 3350 is on the top of the list of best welding helmets which are available at very reasonable price as well. A person may choose to buy Antra AH6 but that is not really compatible for long time working.

To keep watching their work when they are welding and saving their eyes and screen from burning, they put on a mask. As the welding can cause serious eye and skin injuries.

The exposure to welding can cause serious damages to the skin and eyes of a person. It can injure the retina of our eyes which may lead to a complete eyesight lose. The high intensity radiations emitted by an arc may prove to be fetal for a person.

Yes. When welding is performed without proper safety precautionary measures, welding causes severe loses to skin and eyes. It may also cause permanent eyesight loses as well. To avoid which, welding helmets are the best personal protection equipment. 

Conclusion

On account of excellent arc sensors helmet, viewing area, optical quality, safety level, price customization options, response time and sensitivity Lincon Viking 3350 is the best choice which is mention on the top of our list. Its very cost effective and an amazing choice for professional welders.

 It has been the top most priority for the buyers. It offers all the features which a buyer can expect form a reliable best quality welding helmet.
